required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predictive Value of Renal Venous Flow Profiles for Acute Kidney Injury After Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Predictive Value of Doppler-based Renal Venous Flow Profiles for Risk of Acute Kidney Injury After Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The prospective single-center study investigates whether preoperative Doppler-based renal venous flow profiles predict risk of acute kidney injury after cardiac surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Each year, more than three million patients undergo cardiac surgery worldwide. Acute kidney injury (AKI) complicates as many as 36% of these procedures, doubling total hospital costs. Even minor changes of serum creatinine in the postoperative period have been associated with decreased survival. When dialysis is required, short-term mortality may exceed 60%. Moreover, AKI predicts increased long-term mortality regardless of other risk factors even when kidney function has recovered. Despite this, clinicians have limited tools to preoperatively identify patients at risk for AKI. Identification of high-risk patients preoperatively could impact clinical decision making around surgical technique (e.g. off-pump) and timing of surgery in addition to perioperative management (hemodynamic monitoring, use of certain drugs, fluid management etc.).
The prospective single-center study investigates whether abnormal preoperative Doppler-based renal venous flow profiles as surrogates for right heart failure predict risk of acute kidney injury after cardiac surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the receiver operating characteristic curve of preoperative renal venous flow profiles to predict AKI after cardiac surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of an AKI risk prediction model based on early postoperative AKI biomarker levels to predict AKI after cardiac surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of serum proenkephalin a as AKI biomarker

secondary_outcome.measure: Association of changes in postoperative renal venous flow profiles with renal recovery after AKI.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at Day 1 and Day 7 postoperative

biospec_descr.textblock: Samples will be flash-frozen for biomarker analyses.

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing cardiac surgery (with/without cardiopulmonary bypass) at Department of Cardiovascular Surgery, University Hospital Giessen and Marburg, Campus Giessen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients undergoing cardiac surgery (with/without cardiopulmonary bypass)
- Subjects who signed informed consent forms
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects undergoing transcatheter aortic valve implantation or interventional valve repair
- Pregnancy
- Pre-diagnosed glomerulonephritis, autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease or postrenal obstruction
- Recipients of solid-organ transplants
- Chronic kidney disease stage 5 (KDIGO) or need for chronic maintenance renal replacement therapy
- Acute kidney injury requiring renal replacement therapy
- Non-end stage renal disease with extracorporeal or peritoneal ultrafiltration due to diuretic-resistant fluid overload

facility.name: University Hospital Giessen and Marburg-Campus Giessen, Department of Cardiovascular Surgery & Department of Nephrology
